p: In response to environmental treatments, testing Bidens species showed differential RDPIs in all measured vegetative and functional traits except the shoot biomass responding to the fertilization treatment (Figure 3). RDPI of B. frondosa was higher than those of noninvasive alien B. pilosa (Figure 3). B. frondosa exhibit higher RDPI than did native B. bipinnata in the total biomass, root biomass, and final height (Figure 3a,c,d), but RDPI of those two species was similar in the SLA and chlorophyll contents (Figure 3e,f).
